Replies.Reply: I've got some stuff to do for the party tomorrow. Can you take Billy to school?
It's a our 10th anniversary, Doug. Its going to be a nice party with nice food and nice music. And wings have carbs, so you can't eat them anyway.
Doug, can you take Billy or not?
You have emergencies?
You busy?
Don't they mind you being on the phone?
Oh. Well, I just wanted to tell you I found a great rate for the Ritz-Carlton tomorrow night. I Thought it might be romantic. Mom can stay here with Billy.
Hey, honey. Snack?
Okay. Lite beer, if you want to stick to that diet.
Hey, sweetie. Having fun?
It's eight O'Clock. It started at seven.
People are having fun. Look at the Miltons.
Doug, stop it. You're being rude.
You're not the same, Doug. The old Doug wouldn't have made fun of Fred Milton for dancing, because he would have been out there dancing himself. With me.
I'm saying you have changed. And frankly, i don't like it. I like you the way you were. I liked it when you weren't afraid of looking stupid. I liked it when we laughed. I liked it when we danced.
Doug!?
Only mathematically.
You used to sing Bon Jovi songs at the top of your lungs. Like you didn't care who heard you, or how dopey it sounded.
Like what? You have a great career, a   perfect family. Money is fine. The only   thing that could be weighing you down is   me. Is it me? Are you tired of me?
No, you don't, Doug. I buy your pants.
Look. We've been married ten years. And personally, I'd like to be married fifty more, but if you stay like this...
It might be. But I'm desperate, Doug. I want us to be happy again. So go on it.
All I want is old Doug back. Please.
Where's Karen?
You all need this trip.
Hey, honey.
Karen said you guys were in trouble. I kept calling your cell, but somebody programmed it to not receive calls from our house.
So are you going, too?
There he is! I saw old Doug!
What about work? And Billy's school?
What "stuff"? This party isn't going to be fancy, is it? Just some friends and a wing platter from Costco?
No you won't. Because I'm going to scrape the batter off.
I went to medical school. You think I don't know how carbs work?
Yeah, I can take him. There aren't any emergencies at the office this morning.
Yes, I have emergencies. That's what my pager is for. one beep from that thing, and bam. I'm off. Like a cheetah.
I did do that. I forgot about that. I need to get some batteries in there.
You know, I use to race a car like this.
Yup. It could really... smoke some ass.
Yes, sir. They called it the dragon wagon. You're lucky to be in here without a helmet, pal. We both are.
Heck yeah, you can jam the radio.
Hey, honey.
Me? Oh, yeah. I've got a mouth right here in front of me.
Well, it's not attached to a head, really. More research.
I don't know. Do you think we really need to stay at a hotel? I mean, Billy has his own room. Why don't we just buy new sheets? Like, hotel-colored ones.
What? I'm just saying--
Emergency?
I've got to go! Emergency!
Acute molar abscess. That's going to need emergency surgery.
Yeah.
Well, let's send him over to an Orthopedic surgeon.
Yo! Matthews is open.
Taking it into the paint. Who's got the D? Whoop, too late, dudes! Booya!
Well, that's not really my shot. I usually hit from downtown, you know?
That's where the big games get won. Back here from the three--
That was a pass, dudes!
I'm okay. I think I'm just going to go meet the guys for a beer.
Right. Yes. Lite beer. No carbs. Just delicious beer... water.
Guys! Come on. Let's go get a brew.
I can have a light.
Hey, Paul.
Because it's Bike Week. That's our annual trip, Woody. We're Wild Hogs.
Hey! She took an embroidery class for those. What has your wife ever made us?
It's not a big secret, Bob. She's a swimsuit model. She's hot. I mean, so is my Kelly. She's very hot. Even after ten years. Not that I'm not still good looking...
Because it's gay, or because I'm not?
I don't know. Good, I guess. Is ten the silver anniversary?
Aluminum? Like, siding?
Yeah, that feels about right. Aluminum is sturdy, lightweight... recycled.
We don't need a map for Daytona. We just follow the group.
What?
No, it's not. It's the slogan for the Downtown trolley.
Well, what kind of trip are you suggesting? Another bike week somewhere?
Well, Daytona isn't the "backbone of America," but it is a tradition. We've been riding with this club for years. Do we really want to miss out on that?
Look, We'll talk about it tomorrow. But we don't need some trip to go "live." We   are living. Free and wild.
Free and wild.
Yeah. It's getting pretty late, though.
oh.
Still, that's late. We should just flicker the lights on and off. People will get it.
Hey, we have fun all the time. But I'm not going to let myself look like that.
No, no. No cheers-- Because that wasn't an accurate toast. I'm still the same, shitty son-in-law I used to be.
Grown up? No, I haven't. I'm still   young. No cheers! Stop clinking!
Well, tell them I'm the same as I used to   be, Kelly. Tell your Dad not to like me.
So what are you saying?
Hey, I'll dance! It's just this music is lame. People like me need a fresh beat!
Awwww, yeah. This is the shit! It ain't 1980 anymore, man. Yeah!
I take you to the... Andy shop--
What!? I thought this was what you wanted? I'm dancing!
Nope, that feels bad--
Yeah. I'm just-- Ow: That's-- Yeah, I should go to the hospital--
Dr. Matthews, actually.
I'm a dentist, actually... I have no idea what you just said.
Stress-induced? I'm not stressed.
I'm not middle-aged.
I am middle aged, aren't I?
What?
I don't know. There's just a lot weighing me down these days, you know?
It's me. I'm weighing me down. I'm not a guy I'd hang out with anymore, I'm...
We are going to be married fifty more years, Kelly. I'm going to find old Doug. I just have to figure out where to look.
Really?
I only got you an ankle bracelet.
Yeah, I'm okay. Just stress.
Yeah. I think that might be okay.
Wow. That's...
You're not wearing a helmet?
You will if your head falls on it.
Well, if we're going to make it in five days, we'll should probably get to Illinois by tonight.
I do. I have this little GPS system.
Hey! What the hell, man? That was expensive!
Hah! How's that feel?
What?
You just did that so Karen wouldn't call.
So we're not even going to talk about this? I mean, shouldn't we at least--
Okay, let's ride!
Why didn't you just bring a sleeping bag like us?
Dudley? You're supposed to bury that.
This is really nice, you know? Chilling by the fire with your best friends. Just relaxing, and enjoying--
--each other's company...
Yup... These are the times we'll remember.
Hey, when was the last time you guys heard me sing Bon Jovi?
Yeah, I know. Turns out there's carbs in the batter. Hey, you know what? Maybe carbs are what I need to get old Doug back.
No. I think I've lost me. It's this thing Kelly said.
You know what it is? I think I'm tame.
A wimp?
No. I just thought that was what you were... I thought you wanted us to guess, and I didn't have a guess, so I said "wimp." Knowing it was wrong...
Yeah, I guess life just isn't as simple as it was when we were in college. Well, except for you, Woody. You're still living the fairy tale. Swimsuit model wife. Big job at an investment firm.
We know, Bob.
There's a surprise.
All right, who wants their marshmallow well-done?
Yeah, I left that one on too long.
You sure you don't want us to spread out a sleeping bag? We have three in the--
Shit! The tent--
Dudley, get the water jug off my bike!
It should be okay. It's fire retardant.
It's too late. Dudley is already throwing it on the fire. The liquid hits the tent and it explodes into flames. The guys shield themselves.
Gas! That's the spare gas tank, Dudley!
That was all of it, Dudley. That was all the water we had.
Yeah. Yeah, just on a road trip.
Okay, well... Thanks for stopping. Have a nice day, officer.
Please put your pants on.
Skivies? What are you, a Newsie?
I guess I get that.
I mean, we would have been naked in college. Why are we... Oh, man. It's true. We are tamed. We're old guys.
I will find old Doug!
We should go.
You guys have to shift every once in awhile. Blood has to circulate.
Look at these bikes. They're all classics.
Yeah, but why didn't he customize it?
How's it going?
Well, not a gang. Just friends. Friends that ride... you know.
Dudley, maybe you should--
All right, guys. We get the joke... Good one. Anyway, we actually should get moving along.
All right. We respect that this is your turf, and we're sorry for bothering you.
The trip's over, Woody. Let's just head back home.
That's the point, Woody. Our lives aren't on this highway. They're back home. We have families, jobs, wives...
Come on, Woody. You don't want to take this risk. You have Claudia, and your job... You have a great life back home.
You really said that?
--I can't feel my nuts, Woody. And Kelly still wants another kid.
Woody, your headlight doesn't even work.
Did you inhale exhaust fumes? Because something is happening to your brain. I think it might be retardation.
Whatever, Corky.
Hey, honey. It's me.
I can call my wife whenever I want.
Yeah. Woody. Good guess...
Yeah, I'm having a great time. No old Doug, yet, but I haven't gotten sun-
Yeah, Bob agreed with him. Good guess again. Man, I really miss you.
Woody, you can call Claudia when I'm done, if you want. You can use my cell.
Hey, Billy! How's it--
Where'd he go?... Oh. He thought you were ordering pizza. Uh huh. Well, tell him I said hi.
I can't believe you made us leave so early. You really wanted to see the sun rise?
Come on, Woody. It looks like a neat town. And Dudley's got another bag of poop to throw away.
Wow. Lucas is a polite town.
well, how could we pass through this town without stopping? Everything looks so perfect.
Excuse me?
Are there any booths open?
You like the waitress, huh?
Mmmm. I'll have what he's having.
No, uh... I'll take a new one. He can keep his.
Hey, it's okay. Really.
Hey, guys. This block party tonight looks cool. Music, grilled corn, dollar beers, funnel cakes.
Not another one of these assholes.
Us? Oh, no. We're from Cincinnati.
No. We're Wild Hogs. That's our gang.
And our rotary club softball team... My wife had extra patches.
Weren't you just hiding in the kitchen?
Well, now he is.
Well, Woody is the one who really--
Nice. Now the paraplegics can park down the block and get more exercise.
Wow. That's fantastic.
Those guys are that big of a problem, huh?
And the police don't do anything?
We'd be honored to stay. Thank you.
Sure. Let's do it.
Okay. Of course you get a vote.
But you didn't plan the voting system. I did. So you only get one. Sorry.
These people love us. This is nuts.
Well, let's not get too carried away with it. The truth is we're just regular guys. Let's not forget that.
He's waiting for you to say something else, then he's going to kick you.
It doesn't get any better than this, huh?
Thanks, Bob. You saved me from all that... buttery, garlicky flavor.
I hope you choke on it.
Well, it's nice to meet you guys. You've got a great town here.
Or Thomas Milborn.
Yeah. I think he really likes that girl.
Ahh, just to escape for a bit.
Yeah. Apparently I've lost him. I don't sing Bon Jovi anymore.
I don't think we need to. I mean, we can have our own test of manhood. Let's see how many ears of corn we can eat or something. I'll start.
Wow. Um... Woody? This was your idea, so... go ahead.
All right. I'm in. I'm slapping that bull.
Wheeeeew!! Yeah!
Ahhhhhhhh!
We just slapped the bull!
Why just one leg?
Hey, Dud. You look happy.
You have a sister?
I thought you said the color ipod was your soulmate.
Come on. Let's go back to the hotel.
Open road, baby!
Are you kidding me? Woody, you're going to have to talk to these guys again. Get them to leave this town alone--
Woody!? What the hell is wrong with--
You lied, didn't you!? You stood there and lied to us!
Live!? We're going to die, Woody! You burned down their bar! We are dead men!
Sorry? That's it!? You're sorry!?
Why? It's just a stupid vacation!
This trip is just you running from your life. Your miserable, screwed up life.
And you knew you couldn't go back to it, so instead you screwed up our lives, too... You asshole!
It doesn't mean anything! It's just a patch my wife made!!
You think?
Thanks, Charley.
Well, you're the cop. Why don't you go out there?
Um... They left.
They're still out there. Passed out.
Bob, we can't leave. They'll just stay here and keep terrorizing this town.
For what? To be stationed here permanently? Because these guys will just come back when they're gone. And it'll be even worse.
We've created this problem, Bob. We've got to think of a way to solve it.
Tell her "no," Bob.
Well, you're going to have to, Bob!
You know, you can storm out too, if you want.
Thanks, man.
You okay?
Hey, Bud. Look, I'm sorry we got your town in all this trouble. This trip was supposed to fix problems, not cause them.
What do you mean?
You're right. That's why I stopped singing Bon Jovi. Life used to be a risk. That was old Doug. And now it's gone. I've taken away all the risk.
It's not. And I have a will, now. So, I only have so much livin' left. And somehow I've lost the best part of it.
These are worms.
I don't get it.
What's that have to do with worms?
Hey. Going fishing?
I've got worms.
I mean, in here.
Um... Look, man. I'm sorry about Claudia. And the job.
But, you shouldn't have lied to us--
You would have stormed off right then, huh?
Well, what's the point of being in a motorcycle gang if we can't ourselves in a little trouble?
It'll be okay, man.
Yeah. We won't die. I don't think.
Well, the good thing is we'll be able to know for sure. That'll be cool.
Did you bring the paddles?
Why were you here?
Hey, Bob. Worms?
Throw us that paddle.
Were those the only two paddles?
Oh.
Yeah.
Well, we can change that.
He's with you, isn't he?
Charley, can I borrow your phone?
Dudley has mine. I'll just call him.
He needed to call his answering machine so his cat could hear his voice.
Here we go. It's ringing...
He probably snuck off somewhere to buy you some romantic gift or something. No big deal.
Yeah. And the girl wasn't even smiling -
Nope. The Hells Angels have him.
We'll bring the money. Just don't touch our friend!
No they aren't. We're going to get him back.
No. Nobody is paying anything.
We're not calling the Highway patrol.

It's not. But sometimes you have to do the things that aren't safe, to create a world that you're happy being in. These Hells Angels don't want our ten thousand dollars. They want our dignity. They want us to be afraid of them just like this town is. And once they know we're afraid, they can do whatever they want.
.The adventure.
Where's Dudley?
Just hold tight, Dudley.
All right. Hand him over.
We're not giving you any money.
We're not going to play your games.
Give us back our friend, asshole!
Ass... hole.
What!? I thought they'd back down!
Wait!! Wait a minute!
You want to beat the shit out of us?
Yeah. But not just for Dudley. If you win, we'll give you ten grand and go back home. You'll never see us again. But...
Well? You in, or are you too much of a bitch?
Great.
Great.
All right. When do I hit back?
Tell my wife I won - then got hit by a truck.
All right. Let's do this--
Ow! Dammit Jesus that hurt!
It really hurts. Damn!
Yes!--
Hah!
Damn.
Ahhh!
Wait! Wait--
Your tooth-- That's an acute periodontal abscess.

look, I really hate you, but I don't want to feel responsible for a death. I'm a dentist. I took an oath. Same one as doctors. If the infection in that tooth gets to the root - it could seep into your nervous system. Just let me look--
Thanks, man.
Just stay down.
You still don't get it do you, Jack?
We are the real bikers.
Ahh, we should be heading back. I think we've had enough excitement for one trip.
You guys ready to head back?
You are?
Hey, baby. What are you doing here?
I hadn't really decided. I have been having a good time, though.
I even got beaten up.
You'll see him even more if you and Billy meet me in San Francisco. We've got a suite at the Ritz-Carlton.
Ahh. We can risk it.
We ready?
I walk these streets, a loaded six string on my back.
Wante-ee--ed!
I'll eat 'em.
That doesn't work.
Dentists go to medical school?
The battery ith gone in that thing. You took them out for the TV clicker.
Uh uh. Carbth.
Really?
Awesome! Hey, can I jam the radio?
Bob?...
Bob!?
You need to come tell Haley she can't go to a party tonight.
Hey, honey.
Well, I'm technically at the office right now, so...
Actually, I need to talk to you--
If that's about the party, you--
Well, I really have to finish my--
You bought this shirt for me. I was fine with my t-shirts--
What?
Well, I have to get another--
You going to wear that?
You're cool with the carbs?
What are you talking about? This place is cool. We're with other bikers.
Hard.
Sorry. I didn't... Don't tell her.
Well, Kelly must still think you're hot.
I don't know, man.
No...
Doug! Are you okay?
Oh, man. Thank god.
Oh, she's waiting in the parking--
That's her.
Yeah? Are you sure? I mean, We'll be leaving behind everything we're used to.
A tattoo? You got a tattoo?
Yeah, the way I mapped it out - we should be a hundred miles past St. Louis by sundown.
He's right, Doug. Wild Hogs!
Yup.
This is more comfortable.
I wish Karen would have let me buy the foot pump, though.
It's been awhile. You're not as obnoxious as you used to be. You used to eat a lot more buffalo wings, too.
I know what you're talking about. I lost old Bob, too. I think my wife and daughters killed him. I'm surrounded by women every minute of my life. And it's made me, you know...
What? No. I was going to say miserable.
You know, it's not always so bad. Like, when Karen sleeps, she still crawls over and pushes up against me. Just snuggles right up like she needs me. I like that.
Hey, Dudley. You've got us, buddy. And you're going to get a woman, too.
I told you we were going to hit some strip clubs when we get back.
Dudley-- Please. I'm trying to help you here.
Please! Strippers are nice to me!
Thanks, man.
I'm just... trying to be a good friend.
I think I'm half way there.
Thanks for waiting for me, jerks.
Whhheew: Yeah! That's c-c-cold: He sees DOUG, WOODY and DUDLEY are just staring at him.
What?
We're swimming. You guys kept on your skivies?
I don't know. We took showers and stuff together in college. I thought this was kind of... you know, the same.
You think? They're gone, now.
Dammit! Leg's asleep.
Oh, man. Check it out. A 1951 Panhead.
Hells Angels, huh? You guys are legends.
What? Are you nuts?
Seriously?
Yeah, I actually agree with you on this one. Let's not call wives.
Hey! Let's stop for breakfast, I'm starving.
I just said I was--
That's how these little towns are. It's unspoiled America.
Wow. Everyone is so nice, here.
Yeah, just don't let it happen again!
Wow. That wasn't funny.
What schedule? You said we're taking this trip to live. Let's stick around and live a little. Have some small town fun!
I'm not a wimp, pal'. I'm a man! You got that? Huh? You got that!!
No, you know what? This guy needs a talking to just like his friends did, Woody.
Let me do this, Woody! You stood up to them last time, and I just sat there like I always do... Well, not this time!

Listen, you piece of shit. You think you can just walk around and bully perfectly nice people? You think that's how it works? Well, guess what? This is the real world. With real laws and real consequences. You hear me!?
Now get out of here! And if that gang of inbred assholes needs things explained to them again, tell 'em the Wild Hogs will be right here in Lucas tonight.
Now get.
Get!
Hey-- we should probably share the credit. I mean, I just basically kicked that guy's ass. Man! You know how good that felt!? Yeah!
Should I fix it? Oh, man. I should.
I'm sorry... I didn't mean to--
You ride this?
Yeah. They think we're bad asses.
It's true. He was unclogging his bathtub drain and the cat thought it was a ball of yarn.
That's a lot of carbs.
Well... Still a nice town.
Yeah. This is good for him.
Hey! Leave him alone! You want some of this!? Come get this!
Hah! Missed me, you fat bastard!
Did you see me? I dodged him! I dodged that stupid cow! How cool am--
You son of a bitch! You want to keep it going!? You want to take cheap shots!?
Give me your gun! Give me the gun! He deserves it!
I'll kill you!
I'm going to go back there with a rifle tomorrow and shoot one of his legs off.
Because I want to kick him in the face.
Wild Hogs ride!
You son of a bitch!
What is that?
It got in my hair! Gross!
You did! You're a stinking liar!
Well, I talked to Karen. She going to fly out here, rent a mini-van, and pick us up. We'll just ship the bikes back later.
So what? They can call the National guard or something.
Well, Karen is really insistent she come drive us back.
I can't do that.
Oh, sorry I'm not brave like you, Doug!
Hey, guys.
Are we all good?
Shit. Hold on.
Yeah.
You guys'll drift in.
Where are Buck and Earl?
That's it. He's never had a girlfriend so he's probably getting carried away.
No way. They said no law. We can't risk them doing anything to Dudley.
I'm going to call Karen and have the cash wired out of our savings.
Let's go slap the bull.
Yeah, Doug!
Alright, Mother f--
I'm in, too! Let's ride to San--
Um... Actually, we just decided we were going to keep pressing West for a few--
--Karen!
Listen to me. This is My vacation and if I want to ride on with my friends, well that's what I'm going to do! And if you have a problem with that, well... Tough shit!
I will. And... I love you.
Are you kidding me!? You work in our guest bedroom, not an office.
Yeah, and I have to go to a job that actually makes us money, Bob. So, get out here and tell Haley she's not going anywhere!
Did you talk to her? Tell me you talked to her. God! I have to do everything!
Your little article for the "Web"

I have a shareholder meeting. And we agreed that my career would be the priority, and you would work out of the house. You might not like it, but my job is higher paying. And I don't see you complaining about that hundred dollar shirt you're wearing.
Oh, you don't like the shirt now? Fine.
Take it off! You don't want to wear nice things, don't. Off!
Now take Claire to her ballet class.
Go! Five minutes!
Bob!? You said two minutes! I'm not circling!!
I told you I was coming, Bob!
Well, I hope you guys had a nice trip.
Okay. Sorry... Just... be careful.
Hey, Daddy. Listen.
Eeeeeeeiiiiiaaaaa!!
For five dollars, I'm not.
No!! Don't touch that! It's Julien!
Hey, Julien. Yeah, totally. I'll probably just drop by and chill.
Dad! I'm talking, here. God!
Woody.
Woody Stevens!

.No, you listen to me. You're not going to push me around. We agreed on a price, and that's the price I'll pay. If you don't like it, walk away... but you can kiss your business good bye, because that's what happens when you screw with Woody Stevens. You go down. Hard.
Money's never a problem. You just need to honor the correct price. Got it?
.Then go home, Toby! You make me sick!
Well, you should have thought of that before you put the "any yard for ten bucks" flyer on the telephone pole.
I noticed that. And if you ever lay your head on my back when you're riding bitch again, I'm going to throw you into traffic.
I felt you smell my hair!
Man, I wish we could find a place that wasn't so freaking lame.
Yeah, Paul. I'll talk to you about it on the trip.
This place sucks. Why are we going to Daytona with these posers?
We're not Wild Hogs. That's a patch your wife made and we all had to sew it on our jackets so she didn't feel bad.
Hey!?
We're not going to say you're hot, man.
There's no non-gay response to that.
Point proven.
--And ready for the trip of a lifetime.
Not if we don't go on the Daytona trip.
Guys, listen to me. It's time for a change. Let's go on our own trip this year. Just us, like it was in college.
I know. But, it works as our creed, too.
No. That's dumb, Dudley. Let the big people talk.
You're afraid to ask your wife.
What do you think?
What? What's wrong with you?
Nape. I don't want anything between me and the road, man.
Look, the only rule on this trip is to have no plan. We're riding to San Francisco, and nothing else is planned.
What? No. No plan. It's the open road.
I did it for the good of the trip, Doug.
It felt good. It felt damn good.
No cell phones!
Yes. Go bury it.
I'm sorry. Dudley, you have to get rid of that bag or I'm going to vomit in your lap.
Don't hang it on a tree!
Oh, man. Thank God that stopped.
Old Doug? You've lost your Dad?
You're a wimp, Bob. I'll say it. You're afraid of girls. It's embarrassing.
You're afraid to talk to one. Bob is afraid they'll kill him in his sleep.
Yeah... The good life. I'm a lucky man.
I'll go, too.
In just one hour.
Why are you naked?
Yeah. That, and being naked with a bunch of guys is gay. What's wrong with you?
No, we're not. Don't say that.
I will be naked with my gay friends, and if they look at my jock, I will kill them.
There's a shallower spring up the path.
Yeah, we could stay another few--
Now this is the best part of any road trip. Seeing our brothers on wheels.
Probably no good custom stores out here in hick-land. We'll leave 'em a catalog.
No, I don't. Doug does. I think it's great the way it is.
Anybody else got that "pre-rape" feeling?
All right. Let's just give them a few minutes to get back inside - then shoot right past them.
We're going to turn back after all these miles? Just because some fat bully's pushed us around?
Good. See? Dudley's got some balls.
I can't believe you guys. What a bunch of pussies. The whole point of this trip is to live, man.

You're right, I do. But maybe I should talk to those guys one more time. I mean, I'm an executive at an Investment firm. I've made a career out of convincing people and these are just people. You guys wait here.
Come after us now, assholes.
They're cool with it. We can press on.
Yup. I tried to be polite. I tried to reason. I told them Dudley was dying.
Well, technically we're all dying, Dudley. Just very slowly.
Anyway, none of that worked. So I laid it out for them. I said, "Hey, go ahead and assault us. Because we might be not be real bikers, but we know real lawyers.
Yup. And I think they'll give us Dudley's bike on the way back, so let's go. Quick. Before they change their mind.
No, we're not stopping here. Riding at night is half the fun. Let's just keep--
So, adopt a kid. You already have two white ones, anyway.
I just think it's just stupid to stop this soon, you know?... We can keep riding under the stars. All night.
You think I won't ride without light? I can feel the road. Let's go. I'll even race somebody. Who's racing me?
I just want to ride. Let's go!
You're calling Kelly? You're not aloud to call wives on a road trip.
You agree with me, right?
Are you kidding me? I have to leave.
No, I'm not calling Claudia. I mean, yes I want to, but I won't. Because I'm on a road trip with my pals. And cell phones aren't even allowed!
Yeah, man. It warms my heart, with it's...
Gentle... rays.
What!? No! We're not hungry yet.
You're not! Fatty!
It's a shithole. Let's keep moving.
Okay, we'll get it to go, then. We can ride and eat if it's wrapped in a tortilla.
Not a big deal.
No, no, no, no. We have a schedule. San Francisco is waiting.
--Oh, we're just a group of friends. No big deal. Your guys gave us permission to pass by, so it's all good.
Bob, let's not get carried away--
But, Bob. I don't think--
Can't you call a bigger town or something for backup?
Oh, thanks, but we're actually moving on--
Uh uh. No, I'm putting my foot down, here. I still get a vote on what we do, you know? And I want my vote.
I actually get three votes. Because I planned the trip.
You know what? Old Doug wasn't such a douchebag!
You're going to go Billy Jack?
What?
You're afraid of your cat.
No he didn't.
I did.
If you're not a kid.
Hey, we're not escaping anything, man.
Exactly. Which is why we need to keep riding until we figure out where that happiness is. You don't get old Doug back by just staying put.
You did lose him, Doug. You know why?
Right! Slap the bull!
What?
We're slapping the bull.
We are slapping the bull.
Wow. So it's literally slapping a bull?
All right. I'm going in.
Hell yeah. I'm gonna slap the shit out of that bull. Like, pimp-style.
Whhhheeeeeeew!
Yes! Wow! That felt so good. I just slapped a big fat bull right on his ass!
Thanks for bringing us out here. Doug really needs this.
Doug, wait!
Oh, no you don't!
Heeeeey! Hey you! Come get me, Bull!
Run, Doug! Go!
No this is living!
Man, did you see the look on Bob's face when he got up? Didn't dodge him that time!
Okay, fine. But after fishing - we hit the open road and keep moving, okay?
Hiiiiiiiidee!
Go! Go! Go!
Shhhh! They'll hear you! Don't make a sound!
I did it for you guys! I wanted you to live!
I'm sorry, okay!
Yes, I'm sorry! I just didn't want us to go back.
Because I don't have anything to go back to, okay!
I've lost everything. The firm fired me, Claudia left me... It's all gone. My whole life is gone. I don't even have enough money to get my lawn raked anymore.

That's why I couldn't go back. This isn't a vacation for me, it's the only thing I have left. There's nothing more in my life but you guys. So, I lied about the Hells Angels. I lied because I wanted to have one thing in my life that wasn't a complete failure. A real trip with my best friends... You're all I got. I'm sorry.
Fine! I see how important I am to you guys. That's just fine. I just thought being a "Wild Hog" meant something!
Hey.
Yup.
All right. Let's go.
Thanks.
You know what? I screwed up! It happens. Maybe from now on I'm better off just doing things on my own!
Yeah.

I didn't want to lose, Doug. I've lost everything else and I didn't want to lose this trip with you guys. When we're together, it's like we're all college kids still. I'm not a guy with a broken marriage and failed career. I'm just with my best friends, being happy. And to keep it going, I forgot about what made it so great... That friends never let each other down. Until now. I screwed up the last thing I had left.
They won't kill us, right? Just a...
No way. And how much could a punch really hurt? Not much, probably.
Let's go find the Bob and Dudley.
No. I wasn't even going to take this thing out, but I didn't want you to think I was just standing at the lake waiting for you.
Bud told me to stand at the lake and wait for you.
Yeah, Bob. We're all good.
Yeah, Dudley's with Maggie somewhere.
He has a phone? What happened to freedom?
I remember that. His pee turned brown and he started crying.
Bob's right. We can call the Highway Patrol after we get Dud back, but we shouldn't piss these guys off while he's still in their hands.
No. No way. This is my fault. All this is my fault. I have some money in my severance package. We're using it.
What?
And the friends.
We can still outrun them. They're fat.
shit.
I meant full-figured.
Just stay clear of the big punches.
Um... Just try and get him tired. I don't think punches will do much to him.
Quick! Start kicking him! Don't let him get up!
Wait!!
Doug's not the leader of this gang. I--
Sure.
You know what? I think I'm going to press on. Keep heading West.
Yeah. Why not? I feel good about my life again. And I'd like to see what San Francisco's all about.
Excuse me.
I think so. Dudley? What do you think?
I can't do this many leaves for ten bucks! It'll take two hours!
Dudley?
It is now nine o'clock am.
Command unknown.
It is now nine o'clock am.
Internet open.
Searching "alternative sex."
Two million websites found.
Searching "sex all the day with child."
Yeah, hey, Mac. How's it go--
Thanks, Mac. Open internet, okay?
Mac. Open. Internet.
Alright, Mac. I'll show you.
Right, because I just opened it.
I guess I need to research alternative specs.
What? No!
I didn't want to search that! I said specs... "all the data to be compiled."
Ahhh, No!!
Looks like it's still just you and me, icat.
Sorry.
Thanks, Woody. I feel really safe with you.
I was trying to keep my face out of the wind.
If I were a girl, I'd be attracted to you.
No, that's the 25th. Ten is aluminum.
Noooo!!
But, I boogie board in Daytona. Can't our creed be "Be cool and boogie board?"
Cool! Born to be wild!
I got a tat.
I'm a biker, dude! I got a tat!
Trademarked, I know. But what are they going to do? It's in my skin, bitch!
Yeeeeaaah! Freedom!!
This is poop. Don't eat it.
It's in a plastic bag. I can't put that in the earth. I'll find a trash bin tomorrow.
Fine. I'll just hang it on a tree.
I'm afraid of girls.
Wow. Now I really don't want to talk to one.
My life blows. I don't have a family.
Nah, I don't like those places--
I know. I just don't--
Okay... Sorry. We'll go.
We need more water.
Oh.
Is anybody else thirsty?
That's what I always say.
Morning.
I kept mine on because I didn't want everyone to see my crank.
I will... Do what Doug does!
Me, too.
Yeah, just a little hobby for us.
We're all successful professionals in real life. But on Tuesday and Sunday afternoons... We're bikers!
Hell yeah, brother.
So who's '51 panhead is that? Sweet ride. Woody has a catalog so you can make it cool.
I wish! I just have a Sportster. It's worth, like, half of yours.
Seriously? You're serious!?
Doug, don't worry. Yeah, I'll have a cooler bike than you, but that doesn't mean I'll get all cocky.
Hey, I don't care what you say! I ride a panhead now! I'm better than you!
That? That's a piece of junk.
Like an adopt a highway thing?
I go wherever you go.
No, my sidecar's just attached to your bike. I'd prefer to turn back, but I could only roll so far...
I'll wait here, too. You'll get better gas mileage.
Leg's asleep.
What?
Oh my god, you're right.
I'm slowly dying.
Um... So?
She's perfect.
I wanted to say something funny to her, but I could only think of black jokes.
It's hard to be funny without being racist.
Funnel cakes!? Let's stay here tonight!
Let's party all night in Lucas!
so he is one of those assholes, Doug.
Ech.
Cool! Let's fish!
Yeah, the best thing is to keep a low profile. Don't cause any waves. Then if somebody pushes us too far, Boom! We go Billy Jack upside their heads!
Nooo. I'm just minding my own business.
Doug just saved you a world of hurt.
Yeah, well... He once bit me on the sack.
Um... I, uh---
What do you call a Mercedes in Harlem?
Nothing-- uh...
I-- have a cookie jar made out of a 2e.
Yeah. They're like fried chicken at a--
I danced with her. And she likes macs.
I have a soulmate.
I thought it was. But now, I realize that ipod was just a well-designed whore.
It's that blue port-o-potty juice. It's coming out of the can.
Oh, man. I thought it was going to happen slowly. I thought I had time!
Crap. I was thinking of that for us.
You do?
No, no. I mean, I thought about going to see Maggie while those guys are asleep, but you need me right now.
You're always asking me if I'm okay!
Sorry those jerks are in your diner.
It makes me sick. Thinking they're too good for pancakes.
This has been the best vacation of my life. I met you.
Maggie, I have to tell you something.
Oh, people will eat. Don't you worry, Maggie. People will eat.
Alright, let's end this!
Hey! !
I'm not here to face any music. I'm here to make you a deal. A deal I think you'd be smart to take.
You leave the town of Lucas, and my friends alone, and I do something for you. Something you can't live without.
See where that says "Domain for sale?"
Okay, then. Thanks for hearing me out.
Sanctuary! Sanctuary!!
Sanctuary. You have to take me to a church and leave me alone.
I know.
No, I actually feel pretty--
Ow!
Hey, a peanut.
Crap.
Don't bring the money, guys!
I'm a computer programmer! I don't need my legs!
Dammit.
Bring the money!
Hey can we call my cat, now? She needs to hear my voice.
Crap.
Hey, guyth.
Ahhhhhhhhhhh!
Ow.
Ow. Ow! Ow, ow. Ow. Ow!...
Yeah, I'll take the Sportster back, I guess.
Let's ride.
Dr. Matthews? Patient emergency in room eight.
Doctor Matthews. Finally. Take a look at this.
That's what I thought. Thank God you got here.
Absolutely. Thanks, doctor.
Wild Hogs aren't welcome here!
Hey, guys... Woody, your tax return is almost done, but I want to talk to you next week about incorporating. A lot of my executive clients have been--
Yeah, we'll talk about in Daytona.
What the hell are you staring at!?
See you guys.
Hey, dudes. Check these out.
We're all going to wear these on the trip.
That way everyone will know we're from the Cincinnati chapter. It'll also get you ten percent off at T.G.I.Fridays.
Now, I have to make an admission. Ten years ago, when Doug and Kelly got married. I was worried. Doug was a little wild...
I mean, he had that old trans-am with the huge engine... Remember how he'd peel out of anywhere? Even the grocery parking lot after buying baby formula?
Or the way he'd just grab Kelly and run off to some crazy island to snorkel with something that thinks you're lunch.
But, not anymore. He's now become the son-in-law I would have always hoped for.
Come on, Doug. You should be proud!
Well, Mr. Matthews--
Oh, really? Great. Then, I can say this a lot easier. You had a hypertensive myocardial seizure.
Oh. Sorry. It looks like you had a stress-induced panic attack.
Well, it's probably been pretty buried. I actually see it a lot with middle-aged men.
Yeah, I see that a lot, too. Anyway. We should have you out of here soon.
Doug stops himself, as it dawns on him. You can see the horror of realization creep across his face. He looks at Kelly, wide-eyed.
You guys all right?
All right. Just making sure.
Looks pretty comfortable, actually.
All right, I get it.
Five's a crowd.
You guys are lucky to have each other.
Damn lucky.
Well... Have a good one.
Saw you're bikes out there. You guys ever chicken fight?
The Dad stops talking as he sees into the water... He realizes, then looks at his kids, concerned.
Janey, Kyle, Holland. Out of the water.
Get out of the damn water! Now!
The Mom sees a glimmer of something through the water, and realizes. She suddenly looks very uncomfortable.
Whhheeeeew!
Yeah, how do we keep missing that?
So you re "Wild Hogs," huh? That's your gang?
So it's like a little hobby for you guys?
Wow. That's great. Can I try that on?
Well, if you like my '51, we should trade... "brother."
A Sportster!? That's what I grew up on.
Come on, Dud. Let's go see how you look on it.
Oh, no, no. That's Oilcan's ride. My ' 51 panhead is right over there.
Yup. Your piece of junk.

Oh, it's no joke. You want to know the joke? Suburban assholes that buy leather outfits and think they're bikers. And it's a joke I'm damn sick of. So I'm keeping your friend's bike, I'm keeping this jacket, and you guys are going to turn the hell around and go back to wherever you came from, because the next hundred miles of this highway belongs to the Hells Angels.
Like a "Go home or we're going to split your skulls open" thing.
You're right. We're going to have to work something out.
Saddle up, boys. Somebody doesn't listen.
What the f--
You've gotta be kidding me.
shit.
Forget it. Those guys are long gone.
They're not stupid enough to stop until they're five hundred miles from here.
Those assholes think they can cross the Hells Angels? Do you know how bad they've made us all look!?
Those guys have some balls. Balls I will put in my mouth and chew on!!
No! I'm not-- I'm going to put my foot up their asses! Both feet! Hell, I'm going to stick anything I can in their asses, and I'm going to enlov it.
Shut up!! I didn't mean-- Just get on your damn bikes! We're riding to Lucas!
I did that in my mind, first.
Good evening, Lucas. Now, as hurt as I am that you're having a party and didn't invite us... We're only here for one reason. The "Wild Hogs." Where the hell are they!?

Come on, now. You shouldn't be protecting them. These "Wild Hogs," not only passed us when we specifically told them not to, they drained out all our gas and burned down our bar. Like the little cowards they are. Now where are they!!?
Now, that's a port-o-potty that ain't worth shit.
All right, then. Nobody wants to tell me where they are? Fine. Maybe this'll jar your memory.
Good.
Saddle up, boys.
And if they ain't there. We'll be back reeeal soon. Because I don't let any man get away from me.
Shut the hell up! I didn't-- You know what I meant!
Alright, Wild Hogs. We know you're in town somewhere, 'cause you haven't checked out of the hotel. We're a little smarter than you thought, huh?
So we're going to wait right here 'till you show up. Weeks, if we have to.
Well, well. One of you came to face the music, huh? That's brave. And stupid.
Yeah? What deal?
No deal.
Try again, asshole.
Damn right, the Hells Angels. Your friend paid us a little visit. And now he's hurting reeeeal bad.
So here's what we're going to do, now.
His hands! We'll break his hands!
Oh, I won't touch him if you bring that money. But if you don't, I'll be touching him all night long. And I'll be enjoying it.
What!? There was nothing wrong with that one! That was tough! Those guys are afraid of me, now. They know how much I want 'em!
Shut up!!
Get me more duct tape?
Well, well. The "Wild Hogs." I'm glad to see you're finally showing us a little respect.
Sure. Where's the cash?
Excuse me?
What did you just call me?
You know what? I was just going to pulverize your friend, here.
But now I'm pissed off. You're all going to get hurt. Hells Angels style. Guys!
Hear that, guys!? He called you all fat!
Me against you?
All right. Let's party, tough guy.
Time for your beating, yuppie!
Don't get tired yet. The hurt is just beginning.
Man, this isn't even a workout.
This one's gonna break bone.
What?
You're a dentist?
All right. Now you're going to die.
Anybody else the leader of this gang?
Well, I guess that's all of you--
Give me the crowbar.
Guess you guys are wishing you'd listened, now, huh?
Are you kidding? And what makes you think you can ride a motorcycle without our permission?
What? You're going to shoot us?
No way. He can have his Sportster back.
Hope you're happy. You suburban posers are a disease. You need to learn some damn respect for real bikers.
Get what?
Yes. Yes.
Ow! Shit, man!
Try and watch the throws, okay Jack?
Owww! Jesus!
Sorry.
I got my old lady bringing some gas. We can get moving by nightfall.
You're going to put balls in your mouth?
Sometimes it helps if you say things in your mind first, then say it out loud, you know?
Oww! Dammit!
Hell yeah we are!! Wheeew!
What?
No we don't.
Ahhhhhh! He shot me! I just got shot!!
Oh, don't tell me they're here again already. I just got the window replaced.
Good morning, gentleman. How nice of you to join us this afternoon.
But you'll change that, huh?
God Dammit! What'd we do to deserve this!?
Not another one of these assholes.
Wait... You guys aren't Hells Angels?
Charley!? They ain't the bad ones!
Thought you might be out here.
Well, maybe it's trying to and you just won't let it.
It's the funny thing about life. It has to be an adventure to feel right. But when you become a husband and a Dad, you realize adventure is risk, and a family man has no place in his life for risk.
Yup. And if you try to make livin' too safe, then it's not livin' at all.
Well, maybe these will help you find it.
Yup. To fish with.
Friends that screw up. Angry bikers.
Go down to the lake and find out.
If you're heading back to town, I wouldn't go on an empty stomach.
Come have lunch. This is kind of our "fallout" diner. Smaller kitchen, but less piss on the bathroom floor.
I have a couple thousand in the diner emergency fund I'll put in, too.
That's right. You mess up our town, we'll do the same to you!
Just stay calm, Dad. At least it's not all of them, this time.
I'll take care of them, Daddy.
Good morning.
where would you gentleman like to sit?
And what would you gentleman like today?
Of course. I'm sorry. I'm so sorry.
Hi.
Excuse me?
Wow. You like macs too, huh? I've got a vintage Apple 2e. Restored it from scratch.
Wow. I like fig newtons.
You want to dance?
Well, we can't seat many people in there, but at least we're back in business.
Ah, we're used to them costing us money.
No, I meant... They damage the diner a lot. They damage the whole town. I'm just sorry you guys got dragged into it.
You bikers probably tell all the girls that.
You're not a geek, Dudley. You're sweet and your honest and... You're the coolest guy I know. Your cat is crazy if it doesn't like you as much as I do.
Well, I better get back inside. I've got to set some chairs up in the family room for the lunch rush. People gotta eat.
Hey, guys. Where's Dudley?
No. I thought he went to find you guys.
Sweet Dudley. He went there to save everybody and now they're going to break his hands.
Wait, he did this because of me. I have a thousand dollars in tip money I want to put in.
I'll move it! Hold on, I'll move it!
You guys aren't Hells Angels?
Well, sweet Mary Joseph... Welcome to Lucas! I'm the sheriff, Charley Baskins.
Well... A non-confrontation approach sometimes is the best method to keep aggression...
Yeah, I was hiding in the kitchen.
I'm an embarrassment.
Sorry about all the confusion when you arrived. Those guys are pretty rough.
Forget about it. We only have one cripple and he gets pulled around in a wagon. Come on, I want to show you guys something.
Oh, no. The Hells Angels would take it to pieces if they ever saw me on it. I just keep it in here. Polish it and so forth. But I'd never let them see it.
Yeah. They ride into town a few times a month and get drunk, damage property...
Well, It's a small town - and me and the Dooble brothers are the only law. And they're still pretty green.

Yeah, I've done that a few times. But the gang is always gone by the time they get here. We've also tried wearing riot gear, which does protect you from being hit, but not from being dragged. Also, one of the Dooble brothers tried to throw tear gas, but the bottle exploded and blew off his ear.
Yeah, he's hard to look at.
Anyway, we want you guys to stay at our hotel tonight on us... Seeing as you're the new town heroes and all.
And if you're not in a rush to leave in the morning-- We've got a great trout stream you might want to check out.
Howdy, guys! Welcome to the block party!
Yeah, we got everything here. Good people, good fishing...
Not if they don't have kids, Earl.
Looks like your friend and Maggie are hitting it off.
Well, Maggie's a great woman.
So, why are you guys taking this road trip, anyway?
I know what you mean. Sometimes things in life can bother you, and sometimes nothing in life can bother you. Either way, you've got take a break from it.
Old Doug?
Woody's got a point, there. Comfortable can be a bad thing. You have to wake up and slap the bull once in a while.
Slapping the bull is kind of the local test of manhood. It's a way to prove you aren't controlled by fear. We've all done it.
Here we are. The Lucas test of manhood.
Sure. Glad we could help.
I think they're out at Mckinley's pasture. Something about slapping a bull. It's up past the lake a ways.
Looks like they're winding down some.
You guys just stay in the station tonight. No one needs to go out there and be a hero and end up getting hurt.
Wow. So... You're not going out there?
That's not cool, man.
Hey, guys. Having your final meal?
Sorry.
They're coming. Buck's ear is giving him some equilibrium problems.
That's out of line, guys.
We sure are. I'm going to call the Highway Patrol. They'll be there in--
I don't think that's the safest plan.
All right, Jack. That'll be enough of that.
I'll ride whatever I want from now on.
I'd stop right there, Jack.
No. Not unless you want to do something stupid like ignoring--
Um... Yeah, I guess we're going to shoot you.
We're not going to live in fear of your gang anymore, Jack. If the Wild Hogs can stand up to you - so can everyone of us.
The point is, from now on you need to treat Lucas with kindness and respect.
Then I guess we'll keep... shooting you.
Good. Now I'd like you to untape our friend Dudley.
And I believe that's his jacket.
And as I recall, that '51 Panhead was traded to Dudley.
Uh uh. A deal's a deal, Jack.
Well, I wish you guys would stay longer.
Get me a beer, old man. And if it's not good, I'm going to smash it across your face.
What'd you say?
That's my gang. I'm on my way there now.
Excuse me?
And who the hell are you freaks?
Hells Angel's don't give permission.
So you grab your girls, And you grab a couple more.
The man drops to his knees at the edge of stage and reaches his hand out to the audience, like the star of a boy band; However, it's clearly making the people on the dance floor uncomfortable.
I'm Earl and he's Buck. Just remember, the brother with the word "ear," in his name, has both on his head.
I can only say that because I'm on his right side. Which as you can see, is blown off.
We do have convicted child molesters, though. We have to disclose that.
Just to be safe, though.
Hey!! Thomas Milborn!
Convicted child molester.
Yup. Big cans, too. Buck liked her, but you know... He's a deformed freak.
Yup. Even torn-open head, here.
Yup. Right on the ass. Then high-tail it out of there, because he can kill ya.
You know, people have feelings. Sure, I make comments about "chum face," here.
Just keep your eyes forward and head up.
Goddammit.
Sorry.
You guys were a blessing to this place.
Um...
I'm Buck and this is Earl. Good luck telling us apart!
I used to like that girl... but then I realized, I can do better.
You know, I slapped the bull once.
Yeah, and we've never seen it done twice in a row. It'll be interesting to see how the bull takes being slapped now that he's alert.
Huh?
Son of a bitch.
I'm fine.
Hey, guys. Having your final meal?
Hey, isn't one of you missing?
What'd you just call me?
It's just a little scar! I'm still better looking than you!
Dammit!
Go ahead and come back! The Wild Hogs aren't afraid you! The Wild Hogs aren't afraid of anything!
And Wham! Doug punches Jack square in the mouth. Jack goes down hard. Woody and Bob cheer.
Yeah! People like you are the scum of the earth!
as the bike falls over in a crumpled heap.
As Karen is saying this, Bob looks over at the guys, then back to Karen. He can't take it anymore.
